note.p: Birth: Milford House, Surrey, England (10 July 1793)
Education: Harrow School; Christ Church College, Oxford. BA (1815);

Career: Studied geology under William Buckland (FRS 1818); travelled in Italy, Greece and the Troad, rediscovering the Scamander & Simois (1817-1818); requested that his name be struck out from the lists of the Society (1824); collected natural history specimins in Spain (1826), Portugal and Morocco (1827), the Canary Islands (1828-1830), Italy (1848-1850) & Ireland (1857); is collections were kept in a museum in Florence; wrote on the natural history of the countries he visited; suffered from gout in Paris (May 1854) and died shortly after
